official-title.#text: To require States to carry out Congressional redistricting in accordance with plans developed by nonpartisan service agencies of the legislative branch of State governments, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Requiring Redistricting to be Conducted Through Plan of Nonpartisan Service Agencies of State Legislatures

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any Congressional redistricting conducted by a State shall be conducted in accordance with a redistricting plan—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text: developed by a nonpartisan agency of the legislative branch of the State government in accordance with
enacted into law by the State in accordance with

quote.#text: in the manner provided by the law thereof
in the manner provided by the Fixing America’s Inconsistent Redistricting (FAIR) Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by striking
, approved June 18, 1929 (

quote.#text: An Act to provide for the fifteenth and subsequent decennial censuses and to provide for an apportionment of Representatives in Congress

header.#text: Establishment or Designation of Nonpartisan Agency of State Legislature

text.#text: Not later than each December 31 of the year preceding a redistricting year, each State shall establish a nonpartisan agency in the legislative branch of the State government to develop the redistricting plan for the State for the redistricting year.
For purposes of this subsection, an agency shall be considered to be nonpartisan if under law the agency—
is required to provide services on a nonpartisan basis;
is required to maintain impartiality; and
is prohibited from advocating for the adoption or rejection of any proposal.

At its option, a State may designate an existing agency in the legislative branch of its government to develop the redistricting plan for the State under this Act, so long as the agency meets the requirements for nonpartisanship under this subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: but instead establishes a new agency to serve as the nonpartisan agency under this section, the new agency shall terminate upon the enactment into law of the redistricting plan for the State.

text.#text: If a State does not designate an existing agency under

header.#text: Termination of agency specifically established for redistricting

text.#text: The nonpartisan agency established or designated by a State under this section shall develop a redistricting plan for the State in accordance with the following criteria:

quote.#tail: standard and other requirements imposed under the Constitution of the United States.

text.#text: Adherence to the

To the greatest extent mathematically possible, ensuring that the population of each Congressional district in the State does not vary by more than one percent from the population of any other Congressional district in the State (as determined on the basis of the total count of persons of the most recent decennial census conducted by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and other Federal laws.

text.#text: Consistency with any applicable requirements of the
Ensuring that districts are contiguous (except to the extent necessary to include any area which is surrounded by a body of water).
To the greatest extent practicable, the maintenance of the geographic continuity of the political subdivisions of the State which are included in the same Congressional district.
To the greatest extent practicable, maintaining compact districts.
In developing the redistricting plan for the State, the nonpartisan agency may not take into consideration any of the following factors, except to the extent necessary to comply with the
The residence of incumbent Members of the House of Representatives in the State.

The voting history of the population of a Congressional district, except that the agency may take such history into consideration to the extent necessary to comply with any State law which requires the establishment of competitive Congressional districts.
The political party affiliation of the population of a district.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of the legislature established under

text.#text: Not later than April 1 of the redistricting year, the nonpartisan agency shall submit the redistricting plan developed under this section to the State legislature and to the

header.#text: Submission of Plan to Legislature and Temporary Redistricting Advisory Commission
Enactment of plan by State legislature
Role of Temporary Redistricting Advisory Commission

text.#text: Not later than February 15 of each redistricting year, each State shall appoint a commission to be known as the

2 members, of whom 1 shall be appointed by the majority leader of the upper house of the State legislature and 1 shall be appointed by the majority leader of the lower house of the State legislature (or, in the case of a State with a unicameral legislature, both of whom shall be appointed by the majority leader of the legislature);

2 members, of whom 1 shall be appointed by the minority leader of the upper house of the State legislature and 1 shall be appointed by the minority leader of the lower house of the State legislature (or, in the case of a State with a unicameral legislature, both of whom shall be appointed by the minority leader of the legislature); and
1 member appointed by a majority vote of the members appointed under the previous subparagraphs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: if the individual meets each of the following requirements:

text.#text: An individual is eligible to serve as a member of the
The individual is an eligible elector of the State at the time of appointment.
The individual does not hold a partisan political office or serve as an officer of a political party.

term.#tail: means, with respect to an individual, a father, mother, son, daughter, brother, sister, husband, wife, father-in-law, or mother-in-law.

text.#text: The individual is not an employee or an immediate family member of a member of the State legislature or member of Congress, or an employee of the State legislature or Congress. In this subparagraph, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall provide guidance to the agency in its development of the redistricting plan for the State.

text.#text: At the request of the nonpartisan agency established or designated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
shall analyze and review the plan, and shall hold at least 3 public hearings in various geographic areas of the State to solicit comments on the plan.

text.#text: Upon receiving the redistricting plan from the nonpartisan agency under

shall submit a report to the State legislature which includes the Commission’s recommendation regarding whether the legislature should adopt or reject the plan, taking into account any comments provided at the hearings held under
, as well as any other comments and conclusions regarding the plan which the
considers appropriate.

text.#text: Not later than 14 days after receiving the redistricting plan from the nonpartisan agency under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall terminate upon the enactment into law of the redistricting plan for the State.

text.#text: A redistricting plan developed by the nonpartisan agency shall be considered to be enacted into law if the plan is forwarded to the chief executive of the State pursuant to

In the case of a State in which the chief executive is prohibited under State law from acting on a redistricting plan, a redistricting plan developed by the nonpartisan agency shall be considered to be enacted into law if the State legislature approves the plan as submitted by the nonpartisan agency without amendment.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to reject the redistricting plan of the nonpartisan agency, not later than 7 days after the vote to reject the plan the legislature shall submit to the nonpartisan agency and disseminate publicly a statement of the legislature’s reasons for rejecting the plan.

text.#text: If the State legislature votes under

If the chief executive vetoes the redistricting plan of the nonpartisan agency and the State legislature fails to override the veto, not later than 7 days after the failed vote to override the veto the chief executive shall submit to the nonpartisan agency and disseminate publicly a statement of the chief executive’s reasons for vetoing the plan.

is not enacted into law, the highest court of the State shall assume sole responsibility for the development and enactment of the redistricting plan for the State, and shall publish the plan it develops not later than November 15 of the redistricting year.

header.#text: Application of same criteria used by nonpartisan agency

text.#text: Upon the publication by the highest court of the State of the redistricting plan under this subsection, the plan shall be deemed to be enacted into law.

quote.#text: An Act to provide for the fifteenth and subsequent decennial censuses and to provide for an apportionment of Representatives in Congress

text.#text: Nothing in this Act or in any amendment made by this Act may be construed to affect the manner in which a State carries out elections for State or local office, including the process by which a State establishes the districts used in such elections.

header.#text: No effect on elections for State and local office

text.#text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to any Congressional redistricting which occurs after the regular decennial census conducted during 2020.
